para.sentence: Throughout this section the variables are assumed to be real.
The results in §§4.40(ii) and 4.40(iv) can be extended to the complex plane by using continuous branches and avoiding singularities.
\int\sinh x\mathrm{d}x=\cosh x, , \int\cosh x\mathrm{d}x=\sinh x, , \int\tanh x\mathrm{d}x=\ln\left(\cosh x\right).
For the right-hand side see (4.23.39) and (4.23.40).

\int_{0}^{\infty}e^{-x}\frac{\sin\left(ax\right)}{\sinh x}\mathrm{d}x=\tfrac{1 }{2}\pi\coth\left(\tfrac{1}{2}\pi a\right)-\frac{1}{a}, if a\neq 0, \int_{0}^{\infty}\frac{\sinh\left(ax\right)}{\sinh\left(\pi x\right)}\mathrm{d }x=\tfrac{1}{2}\tan\left(\tfrac{1}{2}a\right), if -\pi<a<\pi, \int_{-\infty}^{\infty}\frac{e^{ax}}{\left(\cosh\left(\tfrac{1}{2}x\right) \right)^{2}}\mathrm{d}x=\frac{4\pi a}{\sin\left(\pi a\right)}, if -1<a<1, {\int_{0}^{\infty}\frac{\tanh\left(ax\right)-\tanh\left(bx\right)}{x}\mathrm{d }x=\ln\left(\frac{a}{b}\right)}, if a>0, b>0.

\int\operatorname{arccosh}x\mathrm{d}x=x\operatorname{arccosh}x-(x^{2}-1)^{1/2}, if 1<x<\infty, \int\operatorname{arctanh}x\mathrm{d}x=x\operatorname{arctanh}x+\tfrac{1}{2} \ln\left(1-x^{2}\right), if -1<x<1, \int\operatorname{arccsch}x\mathrm{d}x=x\operatorname{arccsch}x+\operatorname{ arcsinh}x, if 0<x<\infty, \int\operatorname{arcsech}x\mathrm{d}x=x\operatorname{arcsech}x+\operatorname{ arcsin}x, if 0<x<1, \int\operatorname{arccoth}x\mathrm{d}x=x\operatorname{arccoth}x+\tfrac{1}{2} \ln\left(x^{2}-1\right), if 1<x<\infty.

Extensive compendia of indefinite and definite integrals of hyperbolic functions include Apelblat (1983, pp. 96–109),Bierens de Haan (1939),Gröbner and Hofreiter (1949, pp. 139–160),Gröbner and Hofreiter (1950, pp. 160–167),Gradshteyn and Ryzhik (2000, Chapters 2–4), andPrudnikov et al. (1986a, §§1.4,1.8, 2.4, 2.8).
